MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's hands-on experience with required technologies (C#, .NET, SQL, etc.) and their ability to apply this knowledge to develop and maintain software solutions. Review past projects, code samples, and responses to technical questions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Lacks fundamental knowledge and experience in required technologies.
Demonstrates basic understanding but requires significant guidance.
Proficient in required technologies and can independently develop solutions.
Expert in required technologies and proactively contributes to improving development practices.

MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions. Assess their troubleshooting skills and their capacity to think critically under pressure, especially in on-call situations. Use behavioral questions and technical scenarios.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Unable to effectively analyze problems or identify solutions.
Requires assistance to analyze problems and develop solutions.
Independently analyzes problems and develops effective solutions.
Consistently demonstrates exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, proactively identifying and resolving issues.

MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, understand their needs, and propose appropriate technical solutions. Evaluate their ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to project planning and execution. Observe communication during the interview and review examples from past projects.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to communicate effectively or collaborate with others.
Communicates adequately but requires improvement in collaboration skills.
Communicates effectively and collaborates well in a team environment.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, actively contributing to team success and stakeholder satisfaction.

MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Determine the candidate's ability to adapt to new technologies, changing priorities, and a fast-paced environment. Assess their willingness to learn and their ability to quickly acquire new skills. Discuss their approach to staying current with industry trends and their experiences with agile development methodologies. Draw from interview answers about past challenges and learning experiences.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to change and struggles to learn new technologies.
Adapts to change with some difficulty and requires guidance to learn new technologies.
Adapts well to change and independently learns new technologies.
Highly adaptable and quickly masters new technologies, proactively seeking out opportunities for professional development.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Examine the candidate's code for readability, maintainability, and adherence to coding standards. Assess their use of design patterns, unit testing, and code review processes. Ask about their approach to ensuring code quality and their experience with refactoring. Can be evaluated using provided code samples, or during live coding exercise.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is poorly written, difficult to understand, and lacks proper testing.
Code is functional but lacks readability, maintainability, or proper testing.
Code is well-written, readable, and includes basic unit testing.
Code demonstrates excellent readability, maintainability, and comprehensive unit testing, adhering to industry best practices.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's proficiency in SQL, including their ability to write complex queries, design database schemas, and optimize performance. Assess their experience with database technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server and their understanding of relational database concepts. Give example SQL queries to write or explain.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Lacks fundamental knowledge of SQL and database concepts.
Demonstrates basic understanding of SQL but struggles with complex queries or database design.
Proficient in SQL and can independently write complex queries and design database schemas.
Expert in SQL and database technologies, able to optimize performance and troubleshoot complex issues.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's experience with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Evaluate their ability to develop responsive and accessible web applications. Ask about their experience with web frameworks and libraries. Can be observed through provided code samples or practical code-writing exercises.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Lacks fundamental knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Demonstrates basic understanding of web technologies but struggles with complex layouts or scripting.
Proficient in web technologies and can independently develop responsive and accessible web applications.
Expert in web technologies, able to optimize performance and implement complex user interfaces.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Determine the candidate's familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban). Assess their understanding of sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Ask about their experience working in Agile teams and their ability to adapt to changing requirements. Focus on real-world examples of experience with Agile methodologies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: No experience or understanding of Agile development methodologies.
Basic understanding of Agile concepts but limited practical experience.
Familiar with Agile methodologies and has experience working in Agile teams.
Extensive experience with Agile methodologies and can effectively contribute to Agile team processes.
